oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uncle Tom RCA-Victor Record Show - 1948-12-04 - Voice track
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: "Uncle Tom" Moore's transcribed voice track for the RCA-Victor Record Show to be broadcast December 4, 1948 over WNOX, Knoxville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Uncle Tom) -- Uncle Tom introduces Bill Boyd record 'Southern Steel Guitar' -- Uncle Tom introduces Jesse Rogers record 'Blue Christmas' -- Uncle Tom introduces Charlie Monroe and his Kentucky Pardners record 'Camping Tonight In Canaan's Land' -- Uncle Tom introduces Bill Monroe record 'Blue Yodel No. 7' -- Uncle Tom introduces Jesse Rogers record 'Here Comes Santa Claus' -- Uncle Tom introduces Eddy Arnold record 'A Heart Full Of Love' -- Closing statement (Uncle Tom)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WNOX (Radio station : Knoxville, Tenn.); Moore, Tom (Uncle Tom)
